The three most important thermodynamic parameters of the electrode reaction are Gibbs free energy G, entropy S, and enthalpy H. The change in Gibbs free energy Δ G is the maximum work of the battery. The change in lattice order is characterized by the change in entropy Δ S. The enthalpy change Δ H is the reaction heat of the electrochemical reaction. These three parameters can be measured by electrochemical tests and eqs 1 – 3
